DESCRIPTION
TITLE & LOCATION

Associate/Senior/Lead Data Scientist – Phoenix, AZ; New York, NY
SALARY RANGE OR SPECIFIED NUMBER + BONUS

$95,000 - $155,000 DOE + Bonus
SUMMARY

Our client is an international industry leader in corporate travel & events program management that leverages cutting-edge technology, real-time analytics aggregation, & partnerships in over 120 countries to provide clients with discounted rates, efficient coordination, & increased ROI.

Moving in a more Big Data-driven direction, our client is building out a new specialist Data Science team within its Analytics function that will be based in either Phoenix, AZ or New York, NY. This team will be focused on developing a large-scale recommendation engine, optimize their metasearch platform, & optimize personalization for their client base. Our client is able to hire in at multiple levels, based on experience. Ideal candidates will be very hands-on end-to-end data scientists who can also convey the application of data insights to real-world business problems. He/she will be a part of a highly collaborative & niche group that will be quite visible, with advancement opportunities projected as soon as 2017.
REQUIREMENTS
  • Bachelors required; Masters/PhD highly preferred in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Information Systems, or relevant quantitative field.
  • 3-5+ years of professional industry experience in an analytics-driven environment.
  • Experience in developing recommender algorithms or building out recommendation systems; Should be able to truly validate recommendation systems & defend personal approaches regarding development
  • Proficiency with Hadoop (HDP) required; Strong working knowledge of Python/Pandas, Spark, R, or other open source tools required.
  • Experience with Natural Language Processing techniques & text mining highly preferred.
  • Experience with Agile Scrum preferred but not required.
  • Experience collaborating in an interdisciplinary technical environment & the ability to communicate technical concepts to different (non-technical) audiences
  • Enjoys “getting their hands dirty”; capable of conducting independent research, likes building things from scratch, & excels in challenging environments.
Benefits
  • Competitive salary, incentives, & full benefits
